channel.title: Every Offline Client Sends Blank Connections [Fixed]
channel.description:
Jesus Christ... I'm a fucktard. The connections were just happening on port 43594, so I'll have to look into that later. Other ports were fine...
~Lin

item.title: Every Offline Client Sends Blank Connections [Fixed]

item.title: Every Offline Client Sends Blank Connections [Fixed]
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“I PK Pigeons, post:14, topic:278298”]Were the connections like this?

Connection from 127.0.0.1:56123 ClientHandler: Client null disconnected (127.0.0.1) Connection from 127.0.0.1:56124 ClientHandler: Client null disconnected (127.0.0.1) Connection from 127.0.0.1:56125 ClientHandler: Client null disconnected (127.0.0.1) Connection from 127.0.0.1:56126 ClientHandler: Client null disconnected (127.0.0.1) [/quote]Yes they were.

[quote=“tobias222, post:15, topic:278298”]You could try re port forwarding or hosting via Utorrent or something.[/quote]I thought about that, but knew it would be pointless since I’ve tried it without being on a network.

Read full topic

item.title: Every Offline Client Sends Blank Connections [Fixed]
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“dont frunt, post:11, topic:278298”]try changing the port and blocking the old one.[/quote]The sad thing is that might just work… o.O

[quote=“counter4545, post:12, topic:278298”]Change the default IP from 127.0.0.1 to something else hur da dur[/quote]Wow you’re a fag. How can I have others connect through 127.0.0.1? I’ve used a no-ip, and my friends have used the client to connect to my server. That obviously won’t work.

Read full topic
